Title: Series: The Amarna Letters
Description: Clay cuneiform tablet; letter from Rib-Hadda to the king (of Egypt); 45 lines; divided into 4 paragraphs; complete.
Bibliographic references: Knudtzon, J A 1915a / Die El-Amarna Tafeln (136)
Bezold 1892a / The El-Amarna Tablets in the British Museum (16)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.173)
Sigrist M et al 2006a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, III
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1996 4 Nov-1997 6 Apr, France, Paris, Musee de L’Institut du Monde Arabe, Beirut : Uncovering the Past 2015, May-Aug, Wrexham, County Borough Museum & Archives, Egyptian Written Culture 2016 12 Mar-8 May, Carlisle, Tullie House, Writing for Eternity 2016 20 May-4 Sept, The Salisbury Museum, Writing for Eternity 2016 16 Sept-10 Jan 2017, Abergavenny Museum, Writing for Eternity 2017 21 Jan-21 May, Museum of Hartlepool, Writing for Eternity
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
